ygData.subject: building Cantera on linux
ygData.msgSnippet: I found the source of my earlier problem.  It was just a path problem. I was compiling with g++ 4.0.2, but was trying to link to an earlier version of the

I found the source of my earlier problem.  It was just a path  
problem. I was compiling with g++ 4.0.2, but was trying to link to an  
earlier version of the stdc++ library.  When I put in the correct  
path to the 4.0.2 libraries (by specifying LCXX_FLAGS in the  
'preconfig' script), Cantera built fine, and the demos work.

So, as far as I know, there are no problems with building Cantera on  
linux.  The latest version of Cantera (available only through CVS)  
should also correctly link to sundials 2.2.0.

Dave
